I am rather shocked at the lack of logic used by the commenters that are "anti-gun". The whole guns subject is so emotional by those who are anti-gun; one can almost smell the fear in their comments. And it's sad as their fear is totally irrational. When Virginia voted for its concealed carry law, everyone was screaming that there would be battles on the street. Same for Florida, same for Idaho, same for virtually all the other states that have concealed carry laws. But I'll bet that not one of you folks has taken the trouble to check whether that fear was justified or whether the battles at the OK Corral really happened. A good reference for seeing how people do use their guns to protect themselves can be found at http://www.thearmedcitizen.com. That web site summarizes news articles throughout the country where citizens have used firearms to protect themselves. Links to the original newspaper articles are there so you can confirm for yourselves whether these stories are made-up or not.

Please educate yourselves (and maybe take a course on statistics, too) about firearms before you make ludicrous comments. You only make your position sound stupid.

I'm reminded of what happened at the Luby's Cafeteria in Killeen, TX back in 1991. A crazed man, George Hennard drove his pickup truck through the front window at lunchtime one October day. He proceeded to shoot everyone in sight. One woman present, Suzanne Hupp, was a CCW holder. Under Texas law at the time, she wasn't allowed to bring her firearm in with her to a restaurant. She could only take cover, unarmed and hope she wasn't the next one to be shot by Hennard. Both of Hupp's parents were fatally shot. If she had been allowed to have her firearm, Hupp could very well have taken out the assailant before he killed all of 23 people.
